intro: Psoralea violacea, commonly known as the violet scurfpea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Psoralea violacea is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
